- .DiskIndex: initial volume index of th: - .DiskIndex: initial volume index of the disk
- .FileName: name of the file in the sou: - .FileName: name of the file in the source provider (vmWare only, require guest agent)
- .NetworkIndex: sequential index of the: - .NetworkIndex: sequential index of the network interface (0-based)
- .NetworkName: If target network is mul: - .NetworkName: If target network is multus, name of the Multus network attachment definition, empty otherwise.
- .NetworkNamespace: If target network i: - .NetworkNamespace: If target network is multus, namespace where the network attachment definition is located.
- .PVCName: name of the PVC mounted to t: - .PVCName: name of the PVC mounted to the VM using this volume
- .Shared: true if the volume is shared: - .Shared: true if the volume is shared by multiple VMs, false otherwise
- .VolumeIndex: sequential index of the: - .VolumeIndex: sequential index of the volume interface (0-based)
- .WinDriveLetter: Windows drive letter: - .WinDriveLetter: Windows drive letter (lower case, if applicable, e.g. "c", require guest agent)
{{label}} field is missing from the secr: {{label}} field is missing from the secret data.
{{vmCount}} VM{{isPlural}} migration pau: {{vmCount}} VM{{isPlural}} migration paused until cutover scheduled
<0><0>A root device is the storage devic: <0><0>A root device is the storage device or partition that contains the root filesystem. For example, naming a root device "/dev/sda2" would mean to use the second partition on the first hard drive.</0><1>If you do not provide a root device, the first root device will be used. If the named root device does not exist or is not detected as a root device, the migration will fail.</1><2><0>Learn more</0></2></0>
<0><0>Archive plan <1>{getName(plan)}</1: <0><0>Archive plan <1>{getName(plan)}</1>?</0><1>When a plan is archived, its history, metadata, and logs are deleted. The plan cannot be edited or restarted but it can be viewed.</1></0>
<0><0>Duplicate plan <1>{name}</1>?</0><: <0><0>Duplicate plan <1>{name}</1>?</0><1><0></0></1><2>All needed Mappings and Hooks will be duplicated and attached to the new Plan.</2><3>Storage map: <1>{storageMap?.metadata?.name}</1></3><4>Network map: <1>{networkMap?.metadata?.name}</1></4></0>
<0><0>If checked, compatibility devices: <0><0>If checked, compatibility devices (SATA bus, E1000E NIC) will be used to ensure boot-ability.</0><1>If unchecked, high-performance VirtIO devices will be used. This requires VirtIO drivers already installed in the source VM.</1></0>
<0><0>MTV behavior is based on the <1>Sh: <0><0>MTV behavior is based on the <1>Shared disks</1> setting in the plan.</0><1>If this is set to <1>true</1>, the shared disks will be migrated.</1><2>If this is set to <1>false</1>, the shared disks will not be migrated.</2></0>
<0><0>Schedule the cutover for migration: <0><0>Schedule the cutover for migration <2>{getName(plan)}</2>?</0><1>You can schedule cutover for now or a future date and time. VMs included in the migration plan will be shut down when cutover starts.</1></0>
<0><0>Specify a list of passphrases for: <0><0>Specify a list of passphrases for the Linux Unified Key Setup (LUKS)-encrypted devices for the VMs that you want to migrate.</0><1>For each LUKS-encrypted device, Migration Toolkit for Virtualization (MTV) tries each passphrase until one unlocks the device. <2>Learn more</2>.</1></0>
<0><0>Your migration plan is set to <1>p: <0><0>Your migration plan is set to <1>preserve static IPs </1> of VMs and to use <3>Pod Network</3> for target network mapping. This combination isn't supported, because VM IPs aren't preserved in Pod Network migrations.</0><1>If your VMs use static IPs, go back to <1>Network map</1> step, and choose a different target network mapping.</1><2>If your VMs do not use static IPs, you can ignore this message.</2></0>
<0>Critical: </0> VM migration will fail: <0>Critical: </0> VM migration will fail due to this issue. Action must be taken to remove the critical concern.
<0>Informational:</0> Will not cause a b: <0>Informational:</0> Will not cause a big impact on your VMs.
<0>It is strongly recommended to use a V: <0>It is strongly recommended to use a VDDK image. Not using a VDDK image could result in significantly lower migration speeds or a plan failing. For more information, see <2>Creating a VDDK image</2>.</0>
<0>Link for the OpenShift Virtualization: <0>Link for the OpenShift Virtualization web console UI.</0><1>Use this link to access the user interface for the provider's virtualization management.</1><2>If no link value is specify then a default auto calculated or an empty value is set.</2>
<0>Link for the OpenStack dashboard UI.<: <0>Link for the OpenStack dashboard UI.</0><1>Use this link to access the user interface for the provider's virtualization management.</1><2>If no link value is specify then a default auto calculated or an empty value is set.</2>
<0>Link for the Red Hat Virtualization M: <0>Link for the Red Hat Virtualization Manager landing page.</0><1>Use this link to access the user interface for the provider's virtualization management.</1><2>If no link value is specify then a default auto calculated or an empty value is set.</2>
<0>Link for the VMware vSphere UI.</0><1: <0>Link for the VMware vSphere UI.</0><1>Use this link to access the user interface for the provider's virtualization management.</1><2>If no link value is specify then a default auto calculated or an empty value is set.</2>
<0>Select <1>Skip certificate validation: <0>Select <1>Skip certificate validation</1> to skip certificate verification, which proceeds with an insecure migration and then the certificate is not required. Insecure migration means that the transferred data is sent over an insecure connection and potentially sensitive data could be exposed.</0>
<0>URL of the Openshift Virtualization A: <0>URL of the Openshift Virtualization API endpoint.</0><1></1><2>The format of the provided URL of the Openshift Virtualization API endpoint should include a scheme, a domain name, and, optionally a port. For example: <2>https://api.openshift-domain.com:6443</2>.</2>
<0>URL of the OpenStack Identity (Keysto: <0>URL of the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) endpoint.</0><1></1><2>The format of the provided URL of the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) API endpoint should include a scheme, a domain name, path, and optionally a port. Usually the path will indicate the server version, for example: <1>https://identity_service.com:5000/v3</1>.</2>
<0>URL of the Red Hat Virtualization Man: <0>URL of the Red Hat Virtualization Manager (RHVM) API endpoint.</0><1></1><2>The format of the provided URL of the Red Hat Virtualization Manager (RHVM) API endpoint should include a scheme, a domain name, path, and optionally a port. Usually the path will end with /api, for example: <1>https://rhv-host-example.com/ovirt-engine/api</1>.</2>
<0>URL of the vCenter API endpoint.</0><: <0>URL of the vCenter API endpoint.</0><1></1><2>The format of the URL of the vCenter API endpoint should include a scheme, a domain name, path, and optionally a port. Usually the path will end with /sdk, for example: <2>https://vCenter-host-example.com/sdk</2>.</2>
<0>Use the CA certificate of the Manager: <0>Use the CA certificate of the Manager unless it was replaced by a third-party certificate, in which case enter the Manager Apache CA certificate.</0><1>When left empty the system CA certificate is used.</1><2>The certificate is not verified when <1>Skip certificate validation</1> is set.</2>
<0>Use the external web UI link to acces: <0>Use the external web UI link to access the provider virtual machine management system.</0><1>You can edit and store the link to the management system to customize the link URL.</1>
<0>VMware Virtual Disk Development Kit (: <0>VMware Virtual Disk Development Kit (VDDK) image.</0><1></1><2>The Migration Toolkit for Virtualization (MTV) uses the VMware Virtual Disk Development Kit (VDDK) SDK to accelerate transferring virtual disks from VMware vSphere. Therefore, creating a VDDK image, although optional, is highly recommended. Using MTV without VDDK is not recommended and could result in significantly lower migration speeds</2><3></3><4>To accelerate migration and reduce the risk of a plan failing, it is strongly recommended to create a VDDK init image. Learn more about <2>Creating a VDDK image</2>.</4>
<0>Warning:</0> This might cause impact: <0>Warning:</0> This might cause impact on your VMs. A feature might not be migrated and will need to be re-configured after migration.
1. Add source and target providers for t: 1. Add source and target providers for the migration.
2. Map source datastores, storage domain: 2. Map source datastores, storage domains, volume types, storage classes and networks to their respective target storage classes and networks.
3. Create a migration plan and select VM: 3. Create a migration plan and select VMs from the source provider for migration.
A CA certificate to be trusted when conn: A CA certificate to be trusted when connecting to Openshift API endpoint. Ensure the CA certificate format is in a PEM encoded X.509 format. To use a CA certificate, drag the file to the text box or browse for it. To use the system CA certificate, leave the field empty.

A CA certificate to be trusted when connecting to the ESXi API endpoint. Ensure the CA certificate format is in a PEM encoded X.509 format. To use a CA certificate, drag the file to the text box or browse for it. To use the system CA certificate, leave the field empty.

A CA certificate to be trusted when connecting to the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) endpoint. Ensure the CA certificate format is valid. To use a CA certificate, drag the file to the text box or browse for it. To use the system CA certificate, leave the field empty.

A CA certificate to be trusted when connecting to the Red Hat Virtualization Manager (RHVM) API endpoint. Ensure the CA certificate format is in a PEM encoded X.509 format. To use a CA certificate, drag the file to the text box or browse for it. To use the system CA certificate, leave the field empty.

A CA certificate to be trusted when connecting to the vCenter API endpoint. Ensure the CA certificate format is in a PEM encoded X.509 format. To use a CA certificate, drag the file to the text box or browse for it. To use the system CA certificate, leave the field empty.
A cold migration moves a shut-down VM be: A cold migration moves a shut-down VM between hosts.
A live migration moves an active VM betw: A live migration moves an active VM between hosts with zero downtime.
A migration plan is a strategy for movin: A migration plan is a strategy for moving VMs from 1 environment to OpenShift Virtualization. It lets you group VMs to be migrated together or with the same migration configuration.
A Secret containing credentials and othe: A Secret containing credentials and other confidential information.
A service account token used for authent: A service account token used for authenticating the the connection to the API server.
A service account token with cluster adm: A service account token with cluster admin privileges, required for authenticating the connection to the API server.
A user ID for connecting to the OpenStac: A user ID for connecting to the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) endpoint.
A user ID for connecting to the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) endpoint. [required]
A user password for connecting to the ES: A user password for connecting to the ESXi API endpoint. [required]
A user password for connecting to the Op: A user password for connecting to the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) endpoint.
A user password for connecting to the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) endpoint. [required]
A user password for connecting to the Re: A user password for connecting to the Red Hat Virtualization Manager (RHVM) API endpoint.
A user password for connecting to the vC: A user password for connecting to the vCenter API endpoint. [required]
A username and domain for connecting to: A username and domain for connecting to the ESXi API endpoint. For example: <2>user</2>.
A username and domain for the ESXi API e: A username and domain for the ESXi API endpoint, for example: user . [required]
A username and domain for the vCenter AP: A username and domain for the vCenter API endpoint, for example: user@vsphere.local. [required]
A username for connecting to the OpenSta: A username for connecting to the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) endpoint.
A username for connecting to the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) endpoint. [required]
A username for connecting to the Red Hat: A username for connecting to the Red Hat Virtualization Manager (RHVM) API endpoint, for example: name@internal . [required]
A username for connecting to the Red Hat Virtualization Manager (RHVM) API endpoint. Ensure the username is in the format of username@user-domain. For example: admin@internal.
A username for connecting to the vCenter: A username for connecting to the vCenter API endpoint. Ensure the username includes the user domain. For example: <1>user@vsphere.local</1>.
A warm migration moves an active VM with: A warm migration moves an active VM with minimal downtime (not zero-downtime).
All networks detected on the selected VM: All networks detected on the selected VMs require a mapping.
All storages detected on the selected VM: All storages detected on the selected VMs require a mapping.
All virtual machines planned for migrati: All virtual machines planned for migration are selected for deletion, deleting all virtual machines from a migration plan is not allowed.
Are you sure you want to delete <1>{name: Are you sure you want to delete <1>{name}</1> in namespace <3>{namespace}</3>?
Are you sure you want to delete <1>{name}</1>?
Area chart with VM migration history: Area chart with VM migration history
At least one row must have both source a: At least one row must have both source and target storages
At least one source and one target provi: At least one source and one target provider in the {{name}} project must be available.
At least one source and one target provider must be available.
At least one VM is detected with more th: At least one VM is detected with more than one interface mapped to Pod Network. This is not allowed.
By default, vNICs change during migratio: By default, vNICs change during migration causing VMs to lose their static IPs. Enable to preserve static IP configurations.
Can not update plan hooks when the plan: Can not update plan hooks when the plan is not editable.
Choose the root filesystem to be convert: Choose the root filesystem to be converted.
Choose what state you'd like all of the: Choose what state you'd like all of the VMs in your plan to be powered to after migration. You can change this setting for specific VMs after plan creation and before starting your migration in the virtual machines tab on the plan page.
Choose what state you'd like all of the VMs in your plan to be powered to after migration. You can change this setting for specific VMs in the Virtual machines tab.
Choose what state you'd like the VMs in: Choose what state you'd like the VMs in your plan to be powered to after migration. By default, the target power state is set to auto.
Choose whether to migrate shared disks w: Choose whether to migrate shared disks with your migration.
Click the pencil for setting provider we: Click the pencil for setting provider web UI link
Click the update credentials button to s: Click the update credentials button to save your changes, button is disabled until a change is detected.
Click the update mappings button to save: Click the update mappings button to save your changes, button is disabled until a change is detected.
Click to select a different provider fro: Click to select a different provider from the list.
Cold migration, the source virtual machi: Cold migration, the source virtual machines are shut down while the data is copied.
Controls the interval at which a new sna: Controls the interval at which a new snapshot is requested prior to initiating a warm migration. The default value is 60 minutes.
Create a network map without an owner: Create a network map without an owner
Create a storage map without an owner: Create a storage map without an owner
Create Providers by using the form below: Create Providers by using the form below. Providers CRs store attributes that enable MTV to connect to and interact with the source and target providers.
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp represe:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created.
    It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations.
    Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
Critical issues detected in your selecte: Critical issues detected in your selected VMs will cause the migration to fail. Resolve these issues or remove the VMs from the plan before starting the migration.
Dates are compared in UTC. End of the in: Dates are compared in UTC. End of the interval is included.
Defines the CPU limits allocated to the: Defines the CPU limits allocated to the main container in the controller pod. The default value is 500 milliCPU.
Delete virtual machines from migration p: Delete virtual machines from migration plan?
Deleting a migration plan does not remov: Deleting a migration plan does not remove temporary resources, it is recommended to <2>archive</2> the plan first before deleting it, to remove temporary resources.
Deleting all virtual machines from a mig: Deleting all virtual machines from a migration plan is not allowed.
Deleting virtual machines from an archiv: Deleting virtual machines from an archived migration plan is not allowed.
Determines the frequency with which the: Determines the frequency with which the system checks the status of snapshot creation or removal during oVirt warm migration. The default value is 10 seconds.
Do not try to preserve the CPU model and: Do not try to preserve the CPU model and flags the VM runs with in its oVirt cluster.
Donut chart with migration plans statist: Donut chart with migration plans statistics
Donut chart with VM migration statistics: Donut chart with VM migration statistics
Drag and drop a file or upload one: Drag and drop a file or upload one
Each row must have both source and targe: Each row must have both source and target storage selected
Edit provider credentials.\n Use this:
Edit provider credentials.
    Use this link to edit the providers credentials instead of editing the secret directly.
Enables hardware-assisted copying by ins: Enables hardware-assisted copying by instructing the vSphere ESXi host to transfer data directly on the storage backend using technologies like XCOPY and VAAI.
Enter the interval in minutes for precop: Enter the interval in minutes for precopy. If empty, the default value will be used.
Enter the interval in seconds for snapsh: Enter the interval in seconds for snapshot pooling. If empty, the default value will be used.
Enter the limit for CPU usage by the con: Enter the limit for CPU usage by the controller in milliCPU. If empty, the default value will be used.
Enter the limit for memory usage by the: Enter the limit for memory usage by the controller in Mi. If empty, the default value will be used.
Enter the limit for memory usage by the inventory container in Mi. If empty, the default value will be used.
Enter the maximum number of concurrent V: Enter the maximum number of concurrent VM migrations. If empty, the default value will be used.
Existing network map options are limited: Existing network map options are limited to those without an owner reference. Upon creation of this plan, a new network map will be created with this plan as its owner.
Existing storage map options are limited: Existing storage map options are limited to those without an owner reference. Upon creation of this plan, a new storage map will be created with this plan as its owner.
For each LUKS-encrypted device, Migratio: For each LUKS-encrypted device, Migration Toolkit for Virtualization (MTV) tries each passphrase until one unlocks the device.
Go to the providers list page: Go to the providers list page
Guest conversion uses the virt-v2v tool: Guest conversion uses the virt-v2v tool to modify all of the internal configurations of the VMs in the plan to make them compatible with Red Hat OpenShift Virtualization.
Health indicates the current status of t: Health indicates the current status of the pods related to the Migration Toolkit for Virtualization, including whether any have failed. For more details, refer to the logs.
Holds the authentication credentials for: Holds the authentication credentials for your storage provider, allowing the offload plugin to securely connect to and control your storage hardware's API (for example, Hitachi Vantara or NetApp ONTAP).
Hooks are contained in Ansible playbooks: Hooks are contained in Ansible playbooks that can be run before or after the migration.
Hooks are contained in Ansible playbooks that can be run before or after the migration. Hooks are applied to all virtual machines in the plan.
I trust the authenticity of this certifi: I trust the authenticity of this certificate
if both 'URL' and 'Service account beare: if both 'URL' and 'Service account bearer token' fields are left empty, the local OpenShift cluster is used.
If skipped, the VMs' disk data will be d: If skipped, the VMs' disk data will be duplicated byte-for-byte, allowing for faster conversions. However, there is a risk that the VMs might not function properly and it is not recommended.
If true, the provider's CA certificate w: If true, the provider's CA certificate won't be validated.
If true, the provider's TLS certificate: If true, the provider's TLS certificate won't be validated.
If you don't use compatibility mode, you: If you don't use compatibility mode, you must have VirtIO drivers already installed in the source VM.
If you specify a playbook, the image mus: If you specify a playbook, the image must be hook-runner.
If your VMs use static IPs, click the Ma: If your VMs use static IPs, click the Mappings tab of your plan, and choose a different target network mapping.<1></1>If your VMs do not use static IPs, you can ignore this message.
In live migration, the source virtual ma: In live migration, the source virtual machine continues to run until the migration is complete.
In warm migration, the VM disks are copi:
In warm migration, the VM disks are copied incrementally using changed block tracking (CBT) snapshots.
          The snapshots are created at one-hour intervals by default.
          You can change the snapshot interval by updating the forklift-controller deployment.
Invalid application ID, spaces are not a: Invalid application ID, spaces are not allowed
Invalid application name, spaces are not: Invalid application name, spaces are not allowed
Invalid application secret, spaces are n: Invalid application secret, spaces are not allowed
Invalid CA certificate, certificate must: Invalid CA certificate, certificate must be in a valid PEM encoded X.509 format.
Invalid domain name, spaces are not allo: Invalid domain name, spaces are not allowed
Invalid password, spaces are not allowed: Invalid password, spaces are not allowed
Invalid project ID, spaces are not allow: Invalid project ID, spaces are not allowed
Invalid project name, spaces are not all: Invalid project name, spaces are not allowed
Invalid region, spaces are not allowed: Invalid region, spaces are not allowed
Invalid Skip certificate validation valu: Invalid Skip certificate validation value, must be true or false
Invalid token, a valid Kubernetes servic: Invalid token, a valid Kubernetes service account token is required
Invalid token, spaces are not allowed: Invalid token, spaces are not allowed
Invalid user ID, spaces are not allowed: Invalid user ID, spaces are not allowed
Invalid username, spaces are not allowed: Invalid username, spaces are not allowed
Inventory server is not reachable. To tr: Inventory server is not reachable. To troubleshoot, check the Forklift controller pod logs.
Issues we have detected that might impac: Issues we have detected that might impact your virtual machines or their ability to migrate. There is no guarantee for a successful migration with any of the issues.
Kubernetes name of the new migration Pla: Kubernetes name of the new migration Plan resource
Label: Label
Link for OpenShift Virtualization web co: Link for OpenShift Virtualization web console UI. For example, https://console-openshift-console.apps.openshift-domain.com.
Link for the OpenStack dashboard. For ex: Link for the OpenStack dashboard. For example, https://identity_service.com/dashboard.
Link for the Red Hat Virtualization Mana: Link for the Red Hat Virtualization Manager landing page. For example, https://rhv-host-example.com/ovirt-engine.
Link for the VMware vSphere UI. For exam: Link for the VMware vSphere UI. For example, https://vSphere-host-example.com/ui.
List of objects depended by this object. If ALL objects in the list have been deleted,
    this object will be garbage collected. If this object is managed by a controller,
    then an entry in this list will point to this controller, with the controller field set to true.
    There cannot be more than one managing controller.
Live migration, the source virtual machi: Live migration, the source virtual machines continue running while their state is synchronized with the destination.
Make sure your migration plan looks corr: Make sure your migration plan looks correct. To make any changes, click directly on the step you want to go to or press the back button.
Method of authentication to use when con: Method of authentication to use when connecting to the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) server.
Migrate shared disks. This may slow down: Migrate shared disks. This may slow down the migration process
Migrate without validating a CA certific: Migrate without validating a CA certificate
Migrating virtualization workloads is a: Migrating virtualization workloads is a multi-step process. <2>Learn more</2>.
Migration network maps are used to map n: Migration network maps are used to map network interfaces between source and target virtualization providers. At least one source and one target provider must be available in order to create a migration network map. <2>Learn more</2>.
Migration network maps are used to map networks between source and target providers.
Migration plan state information and pro: Migration plan state information and progress
Migration plans are used to document the: Migration plans are used to document the moving of virtualization workloads from source providers to target providers.

Migration plans are used to document the moving of virtualization workloads from source providers to target providers. At least one source and one target provider must be available in order to create a migration plan. <2>Learn more about migration plans</2>.
Migration storage maps are used to map s: Migration storage maps are used to map source storages to OpenShift Virtualization storage classes. At least one source and one target provider must be available in order to create a migration storage map. <2>Learn more</2>.
Migration storage maps are used to map storages between source and target providers.
Migration Toolkit for Virtualization (MT: Migration Toolkit for Virtualization (MTV) migrates virtual machines at scale to <2>Red Hat OpenShift Virtualization</2>. This allows organizations to more easily access workloads running on virtual machines while developing new cloud-native applications.
MTV behavior is based on the Shared disk: MTV behavior is based on the Shared disks setting in the plan. If checked, the shared disks will be migrated, otherwise the shared disks will not be migrated.
Must enable Changed Block Tracking (CBT): Must enable Changed Block Tracking (CBT) for warm migration
Name: Name
Name is primarily intended for creation: Name is primarily intended for creation idempotence and configuration definition. Cannot be updated.
Name your plan and choose the project yo: Name your plan and choose the project you would like it to be created in.
Namespace defines the space within which:
Namespace defines the space within which each name must be unique.
     An empty namespace is equivalent to the "default" namespace, but "default" is the canonical representation.
     Not all objects are required to be scoped to a namespace -
     the value of this field for those objects will be empty.
Network maps ensure that the network con: Network maps ensure that the network configurations of your migrating virtual machines (VMs) are correctly translated and applied in the target environment.
Network name template is a template for: Network name template is a template for generating network interface names in the target virtual machine.
Networks used by the selected VMs: Networks used by the selected VMs
No concerns found for this virtual machi: No concerns found for this virtual machine.
No network maps found in project <1>{nam: No network maps found in project <1>{namespace}</1>.
No results match the filter criteria. Cl: No results match the filter criteria. Clear all filters and try again.
No secret found based on provider data.
No secrets available for this provider: No secrets available for this provider
No source networks are available for the: No source networks are available for the selected VMs.
No source storages are available for the: No source storages are available for the selected VMs.
No storage maps found in project <1>{nam: No storage maps found in project <1>{namespace}</1>.
No value for provider web UI link: No value for provider web UI link

Number of data stores in provider.

Number of projects in OpenStack cluster.

Number of storage domains in provider.

Number of virtual machines in provider.
of your selected VMs do not have CBT ena: of your selected VMs do not have CBT enabled.

Optional: Ansible playbook. If you speci: Optional: Ansible playbook. If you specify a playbook, the image must be hook-runner.

Other storages present on the source provider
Plan name must be unique across all name: Plan name must be unique across all namespaces.
Plan name must contain only lowercase al: Plan name must contain only lowercase alphanumeric characters or '-', and must start or end with lowercase alphanumeric character.
Plans cannot be modified during migratio: Plans cannot be modified during migration
Please choose a NetworkAttachmentDefinit: Please choose a NetworkAttachmentDefinition for data transfer.
Please choose a NetworkAttachmentDefinition for default data transfer.
Please choose a target project for the m: Please choose a target project for the migrated virtual machines.
Preserve the CPU model and flags the VM: Preserve the CPU model and flags the VM runs with in its oVirt cluster.
Preserve the static IPs of the virtual m: Preserve the static IPs of the virtual machines migrated
Preserve the static IPs of virtual machi: Preserve the static IPs of virtual machines migrated from vSphere.
Preserving the static IPs might not work: Preserving the static IPs might not work as expected - go back and choose a different mapping for your migration plan
Projects, also known as namespaces, sepa: Projects, also known as namespaces, separate resources within clusters.

Projects, also known as namespaces, separate resources within clusters. The target project is the project, within your selected target provider, that your virtual machines will be migrated to. This is different from the project that your migration plan will be created in and where your provider was created.
Provide a name now, or we'll generate on: Provide a name now, or we'll generate one when the map is created.
Provide a name now, or we'll generate one when the map is created. You can find your network maps under the Network maps page.
Provide a name now, or we'll generate one when the map is created. You can find your storage maps under the Storage maps page.
Provide the storage device or partition: Provide the storage device or partition that contains the root filesystem. If left blank, the first root device will be used.
Providers refer to environments where th: Providers refer to environments where the virtual machines originate from or are moved to during the migration process.
PVC name template is a template for gene: PVC name template is a template for generating persistent volume claims (PVC) names for VM disks.
Root filesystem format should start with: Root filesystem format should start with "/dev/sd[X]", see documentation for more information.
Select a source provider to list availab: Select a source provider to list available source storages
Select a target provider to list availab: Select a target provider to list available target projects
Select an existing network map or use a: Select an existing network map or use a new network map.
Select an existing storage map or use a: Select an existing storage map or use a new storage map.
Select at least one virtual machine.
Select the provider you would like to mi: Select the provider you would like to migrate your virtual machines from (source provider) and the provider you want to migrate your virtual machines to (target provider).
Select the virtual machines you want to: Select the virtual machines you want to migrate. To help find the virtual machines you're looking for, try using the filters.
Selected columns will be displayed in th: Selected columns will be displayed in the table.
Set to preserve the CPU model: Set to preserve the CPU model
Set to preserve the static IPs: Set to preserve the static IPs
Sets the maximum number of virtual machi: Sets the maximum number of virtual machines or disks that can be migrated simultaneously, varies by the source provider type and by the settings of the migration.<1></1><2></2>The default value is 20 virtual machines or disks.
Sets the memory limits allocated to the: Sets the memory limits allocated to the inventory container in the controller pod. The default value is 1000Mi.
Sets the memory limits allocated to the main container in the controller pod. The default value is 800Mi.
Settings are applied across all projects: Settings are applied across all projects on the Migration Toolkit for Virtualization operator.
Skip VMware Virtual Disk Development Kit: Skip VMware Virtual Disk Development Kit (VDDK) SDK acceleration (not recommended).
Specify a list of passphrases for the Li: Specify a list of passphrases for the Linux Unified Key Setup (LUKS)-encrypted devices for the VMs that you want to migrate.
Specify the type of source provider. All:
Specify the type of source provider. Allowed values are ova, ovirt, vsphere,
      openshift, and openstack. This label is needed to verify the credentials are correct when the remote system is accessible and, for RHV, to retrieve the Manager CA certificate when
      a third-party certificate is specified.
Storage maps define how the storage of s: Storage maps define how the storage of source VMs will be provisioned on the target cluster by linking source storage entities to target storage classes.
Storages used by the selected VMs: Storages used by the selected VMs
Switch those VMs to cold migration or en: Switch those VMs to cold migration or enable CBT in VMware before running the plan; otherwise the migration will fail.
The certificate is not a valid PEM-encod: The certificate is not a valid PEM-encoded X.509 certificate
The chosen provider is no longer availab: The chosen provider is no longer available.
The commercial product name or model of: The commercial product name or model of the storage system being used. This helps ensure the correct features and APIs will be used.
The current certificate does not match t: The current certificate does not match the certificate fetched from URL. Manually validate the fingerprint before proceeding.
The edit mappings button is disabled if: The edit mappings button is disabled if the plan started running and at least one virtual machine was migrated successfully or when the plan status does not enable editing.
The Manager CA certificate unless it was: The Manager CA certificate unless it was replaced by a third-party certificate, in which case, enter the Manager Apache CA certificate.
The mapping data from the inventory is n: The mapping data from the inventory is not available, {{resourcesError}}.
The password for the ESXi host admin: The password for the ESXi host admin
The plan has not been executed for migra: The plan has not been executed for migration.
The plan hooks were manually configured: The plan hooks were manually configured
the plan is configured with different ho: the plan is configured with different hooks for different virtual machines
the plan is configured with more then on: the plan is configured with more then one hook per step
The plan is currently in progress: The plan is currently in progress
The plan LUKS decryption keys were manua: The plan LUKS decryption keys were manually configured
The plan migration might not work as exp: The plan migration might not work as expected - choose a different mapping for your migration plan
The plan rootDisk keys was manually conf: The plan rootDisk keys was manually configured
The project that your migration plan wil: The project that your migration plan will be created in. Only projects with providers in them can be selected.
The project that your provider will be c: The project that your provider will be created in.
The project that your storage map will b: The project that your storage map will be created in.
The provider name is a invalid. It shoul: The provider name is a invalid. It should contain only lowercase alphanumeric characters or '-', and must start or end with lowercase alphanumeric character
The Secret was not loaded. Try reloading: The Secret was not loaded. Try reloading the page or check if the secret exists.
The source mapping data from the invento: The source mapping data from the inventory is not available: {{resourcesError}}.
The target project is the project, withi: The target project is the project, within your selected target provider, that your virtual machines will be migrated to. This is different from the project that your migration plan will be created in and where your provider was created.
The target storage mapping data from the: The target storage mapping data from the inventory is not available: {{resourcesError}}.
The URL of the OpenStack Identity (Keyst: The URL of the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) endpoint, for example: https://identity_service.com:5000/v3
The URL of the Red Hat Virtualization Ma: The URL of the Red Hat Virtualization Manager (RHVM) API endpoint, for example: https://rhv-host-example.com/ovirt-engine/api .
The URL of the vCenter API endpoint, for: The URL of the vCenter API endpoint, for example: https://vCenter-host-example.com/sdk.
The username for the ESXi host admin: The username for the ESXi host admin
The virtual machines will be permanently: The virtual machines will be permanently deleted from your migration plan.
The VM specific template will override t: The VM specific template will override the template set in the plan.
There are no providers in project <1>{na: There are no providers in project <1>{namespace}</1>. Create one from the <4>Providers page</4>
This resource is managed by <2></2> and: This resource is managed by <2></2> and any modifications might be overwritten. Edit the managing resource to preserve changes.
This secret must be created in your proj: This secret must be created in your project beforehand, typically using details provided by your storage administrator.
This significantly speeds up the migrati: This significantly speeds up the migration process and frees up network and host resources by avoiding the need to pull data through the source host.
To resume, the cutover must be scheduled: To resume, the cutover must be scheduled. When the cutover starts the {{vmCount}} VM{{isPlural}} included in this plan will shut down.
To troubleshoot, check and edit your pla: To troubleshoot, check and edit your plan <2>mappings</2>.
To troubleshoot, check the Forklift cont: To troubleshoot, check the Forklift controller pod logs.
To troubleshoot, view the network map de:
To troubleshoot, view the network map details page
          and check the Forklift controller pod logs.
To troubleshoot, view the provider statu:
To troubleshoot, view the provider status available in the provider details page
          and check the Forklift controller pod logs.
Unable to retrieve virtual machines data: Unable to retrieve virtual machines data.
updating the hooks will override the cur: updating the hooks will override the current configuration.
updating the LUKS decryption keys will o: updating the LUKS decryption keys will override the current configuration.
updating the root disk number will overr: updating the root disk number will override the current configuration.
Upload a VDDK archive and build a VDDK i: Upload a VDDK archive and build a VDDK init image from it.
URL of the API endpoint of the Red Hat V: URL of the API endpoint of the Red Hat Virtualization Manager (RHVM) on which the source VM is mounted. Ensure that the URL includes the path leading to the RHVM API server, usually /ovirt-engine/api. For example, https://rhv-host-example.com/ovirt-engine/api.
URL of the API endpoint of the vCenter o: URL of the API endpoint of the vCenter on which the source VM is mounted. Ensure that the URL includes the sdk path, usually <1>/sdk</1>.<3></3><4></4>For example: <6>https://vCenter-host-example.com/sdk</6>.<8></8><9></9>If a certificate for FQDN is specified, the value of this field needs to match the FQDN in the certificate.
URL of the NFS file share that serves th: URL of the NFS file share that serves the OVA., for example, 10.10.0.10:/ova
URL of the Openshift Virtualization API: URL of the Openshift Virtualization API endpoint.
URL of the Openshift Virtualization API endpoint. Empty might be used for the host provider.
URL of the OpenStack Identity (Keystone): URL of the OpenStack Identity (Keystone) endpoint. For example: <2>https://identity_service.com:5000/v3</2>.
URL of the providers API endpoint. The U:
URL of the providers API endpoint. The URL must be a valid endpoint for the provider type, see
      the documentation for each provider type to learn more about the URL format.
Use the default target provider transfer: Use the default target provider transfer network
Use the provider's default transfer netw: Use the provider's default transfer network
Use the suggested network mapping and ad: Use the suggested network mapping and add mappings to it, or create a brand new one as needed. A new map, with this plan as its owner, will be automatically created based on your selected mappings.
Use the suggested storage mapping and ad: Use the suggested storage mapping and add mappings to it, or create a brand new one as needed. A new map, with this plan as its owner, will be automatically created based on your selected mappings.
Use when VMs have static IPs that must r: Use when VMs have static IPs that must remain unchanged after migration.
User name is required, the user name usu: User name is required, the user name usually include `@` char, for example: name@internal .
User name password is required, user pas: User name password is required, user password for connecting to the Red Hat Virtualization Manager (RHVM) API endpoint.
User name usually include `@` char, for: User name usually include `@` char, for example: name@internal .
User name usually include the domain, fo: User name usually include the domain, for example: user@vsphere.local
Variables that can be used for the templ: Variables that can be used for the template:
Virtual Disk Development Kit (VDDK) cont: Virtual Disk Development Kit (VDDK) container init image path. The path must be empty or a valid container image path in the format of <2>registry_route_or_server_path/vddk:‹tag›</2>.<4></4><5></5>To accelerate migration and reduce the risk of a plan failing, it is strongly recommended to specify a VDDK init image.
VMs included in cold migrations are shut: VMs included in cold migrations are shut down during migration.
VMs included in live migrations migrate: VMs included in live migrations migrate without downtime.
VMs included in warm migrations migrate: VMs included in warm migrations migrate with minimal downtime.
Volume name template is a template for g: Volume name template is a template for generating volume interface names in the target virtual machine.
Warm migration copies most VM data while: Warm migration copies most VM data while it is still running; at cut-over the VM is paused and the rest of the data is copied.
Warm migration, most of the data is copi: Warm migration, most of the data is copied during the precopy stage while the source virtual machines (VMs) are running.
Warning: not all virtual machines are co: Warning: not all virtual machines are configures using the same LUKS secret
Warning: not all virtual machines are configures using the same root disk number,
Whether this is a live migration: Whether this is a live migration
Whether this is a live migration.
Whether this is a warm migration: Whether this is a warm migration
Whether this is a warm migration.
Whether to preserve the CPU model: Whether to preserve the CPU model
With a cold migration, we will move the: With a cold migration, we will move the shut down VM between hosts.
With a live migration, we will move an a: With a live migration, we will move an active virtual machine without downtime.
With a warm migration, we will move an a: With a warm migration, we will move an active virtual machine between hosts with minimal downtime. This is not a live migration.
You can always bring this welcome card b: You can always bring this welcome card back into view by clicking 'Show the welcome card' in the page heading.
You can cancel the migration of virtual: You can cancel the migration of virtual machines in a running migration plan.
You can change the migration transfer ne:
You can change the migration transfer network for this plan.
        If you defined a migration transfer network for the OpenShift Virtualization provider
        and if the network is in the target namespace, the network that you defined is the default
        network for all migration plans. Otherwise, the pod network is used.
You can migrate virtual machines from:: You can migrate virtual machines from:
You can select a default migration netwo:
You can select a default migration network for an OpenShift Virtualization provider in the
    Red Hat OpenShift web console to improve performance. The default migration network is used to
    transfer disks to the namespaces in which it is configured.If you do not select a migration network,
    the default migration network is the pod network, which might not be optimal for disk transfer.

You can select a default migration network for an OpenShift Virtualization provider in the Red Hat OpenShift web console to improve performance.
        The default migration network is used to transfer disks to the namespaces in which it is configured.If you do not select a migration network,
        the default migration network is the pod network, which might not be optimal for disk transfer.
You can select a migration network for a: You can select a migration network for a source provider to reduce risk to the source environment and to improve performance.
You can select a migration network. If y:
You can select a migration network. If you do not select a migration network,
            the default migration network is set to the providers default transfer network.
You can select a migration network. If you do not select a migration network, the default migration network is set to the providers default transfer network.
You can select a migration target projec: You can select a migration target project for the migration virtual machines.
You can use a custom hook-runner image o: You can use a custom hook-runner image or specify a custom image, for example quay.io/konveyor/hook-runner.
You can write configuration files for th: You can write configuration files for the Migration Toolkit for Virtualization using YAML, a human-readable data serialization language.
You do not have any network maps without: You do not have any network maps without owner references.
You do not have any storage maps without: You do not have any storage maps without owner references.
You must select a source and target stor: You must select a source and target storage
Your migration plan preserves the static: Your migration plan preserves the static IPs of VMs and uses Pod Networking target network mapping. This combination isn't supported, because VM IPs aren't preserved in Pod Networking migrations.
Your selected network mappings will auto: Your selected network mappings will automatically save as a network map when your plan is created.
Your selected storage mappings will auto: Your selected storage mappings will automatically save as a storage map when your plan is created.
